div.p:
Will you kindly
forward this note
to MrBrodie?

A gentleman called Robert
Arthingtonof
Leedswishes to
make an effort
to introduce the
bible into Angola
He has been led to
this from reading
my account of
that country. He
seems of a very
ardent temperament
uses the word Hallelujah! in his
letters and is
possessed of
means. I don't
know him at
all more than he
sometimes writes
to me, and in the
course he proposed
to adopt I feared
that he might lose a
deal of money & do
no good. I therefore
advised caution
in dealing with the
Portuguese. This
advice he has
taken in good spirit
and now asks me
to tell him what
salary outfit
passage money &c
ought to be given
to a man who
has been agent for
British & F. Bible
Society who proposed
to settle at Loanda
I advise him now
to apply to MrSilva
through your elder
and tell him that
I don't know any
thing of Silvas religious
feelings but that
the Portuguese
generally have very
weak religious
convictions and
I have given him
Mr Brodies card
with the assurance
that he will have
christian sympathy
with him. The
card is gone and
not knowing MrBrodiesaddress
I venture to trouble you.With kind
regards to
MrsH &
family
David Livingstone

Sir Roderickhad a thousand at
his reception last night.
Everybody was there & DrBeke
the would be source of the Nile man.
